edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course

Class Course

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.Activity
      • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.Course
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Conflict, java.lang.Comparable<Course>

    public class Course
extends Activity
implements java.lang.Comparable<Course>
    Creates a Course object that contains the name, title, section, credit hours, instructor id, meeting days start time and end time. It also has various methods to get and set the Course's information..
    Author:
    Ben Ioppolo

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a Course object with the given name, title, section, credits, instructorId, and meetingDays for courses that are arranged.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Course

        public Course(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String title,
              java.lang.String section,
              int credits,
              java.lang.String instructorId,
              int enrollmentCap,
              java.lang.String meetingDays,
              int startTime,
              int endTime)
        Constructs a Course object with values for all fields. title, meetingDays, startTime, and endTime are all sent to the Activity class for construction.
        Parameters:
        name - name of course
        title - title of course
        section - section of course
        credits - credit hours of course
        instructorId - instructors unity id
        meetingDays - meeting days for course as series of chars
        startTime - start time for course
        endTime - end time for course
        enrollmentCap - the number of students that can register for the course

      • Course

        public Course(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String title,
              java.lang.String section,
              int credits,
              java.lang.String instructorId,
              int enrollmentCap,
              java.lang.String meetingDays)
        Creates a Course object with the given name, title, section, credits, instructorId, and meetingDays for courses that are arranged. This is done by calling the primary constructor with the given parameters plus default parameters for the missing parameters (endTime and startTime).
        Parameters:
        name - name of course
        title - title of course
        section - section of course
        credits - credit hours of course
        instructorId - instructors unity id
        meetingDays - meeting days for course as series of chars
        enrollmentCap - the number of students that can register for the course

      • setSection

        public void setSection(java.lang.String section)
        sets the Course's section. if the section string's length is not equal to SECTION_LENGTH, if null, or if the characters are not digits, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown
        Parameters:
        section - the section to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if section's length is not equal to SECTION_LENGTH, if null, or if the characters are not digits

      • setCredits

        public void setCredits(int credits)
        sets the Course's credits. if the credits are less than MIN_CREDITS or credits are greater than MAX_CREDITS an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        credits - the credits to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if MIN_CREDITS is greater than credits or credits is greater than MAX_CREDITS

      • getInstructorId

        public java.lang.String getInstructorId()

      • setInstructorId

        public void setInstructorId(java.lang.String instructorId)
        sets the Course's instructorId. if instructorId is null or empty an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        instructorId - the instructorId to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if instructorId is null or empty

      • setMeetingDays

        public void setMeetingDays(java.lang.String meetingDays)
        sets the Course's meetingDays. If meetingDays is null, empty, if the only meetingDay is not M, T, W, H, F, or A, if multiple meetingDays are provided and A is included, or if multiple meetingDays are provided and 1 or more do not match M, T, W, H, or F, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Overrides:
        setMeetingDays in class Activity
        Parameters:
        meetingDays - the meetingDays to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if meetingDays is null, empty, if the only meetingDay is not M, T, W, H, F, or A, if multiple meetingDays are provided and A is included, or if multiple meetingDays are provided and 1 or more do not match M, T, W, H, or F.

      • isDuplicate

        public boolean isDuplicate(Activity activity)
        Checks if the passed activity has the same name as this course
        Specified by:
        isDuplicate in class Activity
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity to check
        Returns:
        true if it is a duplicate otherwise false.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Course c)
        compares the passed course to this course on the name and then section parameters. This is done by creating a string from those parameters for each course object and then comparing the strings via the compareTo method in comparable.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Course>
        Returns:
        compareResult the result of the comparison which will be an integer 0 (equal), greater than 0 (this object is greater than the passed object), or less than 0 (object less than passed object).

      • getCourseRoll

        public CourseRoll getCourseRoll()
        Gets the course roll which shows which students are registered for the course
        Returns:
        roll The linked list that shows which students are registered for the course.
